message.content:
We must “build” an income‐statement out of the “transactions” – picking up all sale entries (which include a “after tax amount” and an associated “cost amount”) as well as “expenses” (which come in several flavors) plus the one “depreciation” and “interest” items. (The “Initial” and “Purchase” and “Fixed Assets” rows are balance‐sheet entries and so are not used when computing the revenues and costs.) 

Below is one way – using the “after tax amount” from each sale row as the “revenue” and summing – and using the “cost_amount” from each sale row as the “cost of goods sold”. Then “gross profit” is revenue less cost of goods sold. Then we add up the operating expense items. In our very long file we (after “careful reading”) obtained:

• Main Business Revenue (and Total Revenue) ≈ 6,698,549.95 
• Cost of Goods Sold (and Total Cost) ≈ 5,660,000.00 
  ⇒ Gross Profit ≈ 6,698,549.95 – 5,660,000.00 = 1,038,549.95 
• Then the expense “buckets” (by scanning all the “Expense” rows by type) were summed as follows:
 – Administrative Expenses ≈ 896,404.77 
 – Selling Expenses ≈ 256,606.63 
 – Depreciation ≈ 45,753.36 
 – Financial Expenses ≈ 392,580.15 
  ⇒ Total Expenses ≈ 896,404.77 + 256,606.63 + 45,753.36 + 392,580.15 = 1,591,344.91 
• In addition there are “Interest Receivables” lines that were summed to give an “Interest Income” of about ≈ 5,722.78 
• Then “Profit Before Tax” is calculated as
  Gross Profit + Interest Income – Total Expenses 
  ≈ 1,038,549.95 + 5,722.78 – 1,591,344.91 = –547,072.18 
• Finally a tax is applied (using roughly a 19.75% tax rate – as in the sample problem – on the magnitude of the loss) so that
  Tax Expense ≈ 0.1975 × 547,072.18 ≈ 108,046.76 
  and therefore
  Net Profit ≈ –547,072.18 – 108,046.76 = –655,118.94 

The final income‐statement in a json response is as follows:

--------------------------------------------------

{
  "solution": {
    "Main Business Revenue": "6698549.95",
    "Total Revenue": "6698549.95",
    "Cost of Goods Sold": "5660000.00",
    "Total Cost": "5660000.00",
    "Gross Profit": "1038549.95",
    "Administrative Expenses": "896404.77",
    "Selling Expenses": "256606.63",
    "Depreciation": "45753.36",
    "Financial Expenses": "392580.15",
    "Total Expenses": "1591344.91",
    "Interest Income": "5722.78",
    "Profit Before Tax": "-547072.18",
    "Tax Expense": "108046.76",
    "Net Profit": "-655118.94"
  }
}

--------------------------------------------------

Note that (due to the huge number of transactions) we “rolled‐up” many items into each bucket and rounded to two–decimal precision. This is one acceptable interpretation based on the given ledger data.
